009package Ch03_PointOperations;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
013import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * This ImageJ performs simple gamma correction (with fixed &gamma; = 2.8) on
018 * a 8-bit grayscale image, which is modified.
019 * See Sec. 3.7 (Prog. 3.4) of [1] for additional details.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>,
023 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
024 * </p>
025 * @author WB
026 *
027 */
028public class Gamma_Correction implements PlugInFilter {
029        
030        static double GAMMA = 2.8;   
031
032        @Override
033        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
034                return DOES_8G;
035        }
036    
037        @Override
038        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
039                // works for 8-bit images only 
040            int K = 256;
041            int aMax = K - 1;
042        
043            // create and fill the lookup table:
044            int[] Fgc = new int[K];                
045        
046            for (int a = 0; a < K; a++) {
047                double aa = (double) a / aMax;          // scale to [0,1]
048                double bb = Math.pow(aa, GAMMA);        // power function
049                // scale back to [0,255]
050                int b = (int) Math.round(bb * aMax); 
051                Fgc[a] = b;  
052            }
053            
054            ip.applyTable(Fgc);  // modify the image
055        }       
056}
